intro: Echites corymbosus, commonly known as the clustered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences and milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, displaying a shrub-like structure with woody stems. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Echites corymbosus is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
